item.title: Manager, Fraud Research and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Fraud Research and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Fraud Management (FM) teams employ deep subject matter expertise in identifying, assessing, mitigating and controlling fraud risks for the Enterprise.  Within Fraud Management, the Fraud Data Science & Analytics (FDSA) team develops and optimizes fraud detection strategies to maximize operational effectiveness and minimize client impact. The FDSA Research and Analytics function  conducts analytic research into fraud issues, identifying causation and correlation, develop insights on emerging trends, gaps or systemic issues, and collaborate with Fraud Management partners to communicate results and take action.

What will you do?

  • Identify patterns, trends and hidden causation and correlation relationships from Fraud data and advise FM SMT of emerging trends, specific gaps or systemic issues that impact the Fraud Risk of RBC
  • Collaborate with appropriate partners for action, correction, awareness and training
  • Forecast Financials and Fraud KPI’s using predictive analytics techniques and generate insights for executive decision making and communicating results through insightful visualizations, white papers, reports and presentations
  • Research business problems, develop solutions to support investigation and analysis and lead progression of analytics methodology, tools and measurement to create development templates for automation
  • Build the foundation of information in consolidated data repositories for Operations, Fraud Events, Fraud Performance and Financials
  • Provide a complete picture of the fraud landscape with drill-down capabilities for root cause analysis and deliver self-serve interactive visualizations through accessible platforms like Tableau
  • Conduct Code Reviews and develop standards for Development practices and partner with project teams to support information required for analysis of the current state
  • Deliver Project Reporting for Fraud Events, Performance, Operational and Financial KPI’s and KRI’s and Program Benefits measurements to track success criteria of the Project Business Case

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 2+ years’ experience in a Data science and analytics
  • Advanced capability in using Python, R, PySpark, SAS, SQL and Tableau
  • Experience with Databases and Data Structures (RDBMS, Hadoop etc.)
  • Ability to apply data and analytics concepts to business problems and explain business value of data and analytics concepts
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize and complete projects effectively and in a timely manner
  • Strong team player with a track record of collaboration and experience working as part of an agile team
  • Professional verbal and written communication and presentation skills, and ability to provide consultation, analysis, and recommendations on a broad range of projects in a deadline driven environment with ambiguity

Nice-to-have

  • Good understanding of Canadian Financial Institutions, with a focus on Fraud/Risk Operations
  • Degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science, software engineering or related quantitative field

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Fair compensation
  • Challenging work in a fast-paced timeline driven work environment
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact 
  • Work with a great and supportive team

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-MISSISSAUGA, CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

2023-06-08

2023-06-24

  • Basic understanding of data science concepts

    Nice to have

  • Knowledge of Tableau

item.title: Manager ,Data Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager ,Data Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC Investor & Treasury Services Malaysia is a processing center of operational excellence supporting 10 countries across three geographical time zones. Malaysia is one of two operational processing hubs that supports Custody - Transaction Management; Settlements; NAV Production; Fund Reporting; Shareholder Services; Global Fund Platform Services; Data Service Delivery; Entitlements – income and corporate actions and Reconciliations. The country employs a Global Operating Model to maximise efficiencies across times zones and supports a 24/5 operational capability. The objectives for Malaysia are to enhance the scalability of our global operations, improve service quality via our ‘centres of excellence’ and to implement/leverage standard processes globally.

This role will be responsible for for the effective and efficient management of the team (GSMF GSP DMUK & DSD AU), ensuring that all services are rendered in an accurate and timely manner Including heavily client on boarding aspects when necessary (client documentation, client communications, new processes, SOL/SLA…) and activity follow-up cross locations with other DSD centers in collaboration with functional leaders.

You will be supporting Europe (LUX/UK) business, working on shift hours of  4:00pm – 1:00am or 3:00pm  - 12:00am.

What will you do?

  • Accountable for the cross location collaboration (Other DSD centers ) to ensure contingency support as well as consistency in procedures and delivery
  • Accountable for procedures validation and implementation including cross location aspects under the authority of the functional senior management.
  • Accountable for KPI information submission and follow-up to ensure best allocation of resources in term of efficiency, timeliness and quality ratio.
  • Promote quality of deliverables and client service by motivating, coaching and developing team members.
  • Identify and share development and training needs, design training plan for the year.
  • Accountable for the appraisal process (set clear annual business objectives and review them mid-year), absence tracking
  • Responsible for identifying areas where efficiencies and accuracy improvements can be made and implement a plan of action.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Knowledge of different investment instrument types
  • People management skills
  • Securities operations experience
  • Willing to work on local MY holidays and follow Europe holidays
  • Flexibility in working hours/ shifts in Europe time zone.

Nice-to-have

  • Flexibility in working hours.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including performance based bonuses, flexible benefits, and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • A collaborative dynamic culture where personal initiative and hard work are recognized and rewarded

Job Summary

Address:

Cyberjaya, Selangor, Malaysia

City:

MYS-SELANGOR-CYBERJAYA

Country:

Malaysia

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Wealth Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-06-16

Application Deadline:

2023-07-05

item.title: Supervisor, Static Data DSD (6 months contract)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Supervisor, Static Data DSD (6 months contract)

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC Investor & Treasury Services Malaysia is a processing center of operational excellence supporting 10 countries across three geographical time zones.  Malaysia is one of two operational processing hubs that supports Custody - Transaction Management; Settlements; NAV Production; Fund Reporting; Shareholder Services; Global Fund Platform Services; Data Service Delivery; Entitlements – income and corporate actions and Reconciliations.  The country employs a Global Operating Model to maximise efficiencies across times zones and supports a 24/5 operational capability.  The objectives for Malaysia are to enhance the scalability of our global operations, improve service quality via our ‘centres of excellence’ and to implement/leverage standard processes globally.

Reporting to the Manager, Data Management team, you will be responsible for the timely and accurate update and maintenance of all static data in Milvus. Setups would include opening, amendment & closing accounts/ static data in Milvus.

You will be supporting Global business with 8 working hours a day.

Shift hours would be between 3:00pm to 12:00am.

What will you do?

  • Setup and maintain all accounts required by the business in Milvus, K+, K+ TP, RBC Mainframe. Business would include BANK, TRUST, DSD Toronto and etc.
  • Act as Subject Matter Expert (SME) for the team, who would be able to provide advice and coaching, as well as delivers the output to others, generally at a more senior level, who make final decisions and take action or manage implementation.
  • To maintain all static data on Milvus accurately and within timeframes.
  • Strict adherence to clients\' service level agreements (SLA) and RBC Policy and Procedure Library (PPL).
  • Actively support an environment of continuous improvement and change management that covers workflow, processes and procedures on an ongoing basis, ensuring maximum efficiency and quality.
  • Constant changes in the regulatory environment that impact the operations, to mitigate financial/reputational risk by ensuring controls are reviewed and maintained in compliance with regulatory requirements or company policies.



What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Familiar with core platforms: Milvus.
  • Knowledge in Bloomberg and CAPS will be an added advantage.
  • Competent in MS office.
  • Banking experience in operations with basic static data knowledge.

Nice-to-have

  • Possess strong leadership and coaching skills.
  • Willingness to take on new challenges, confident and self-motivated

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including performance based bonuses, flexible benefits, and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • A collaborative dynamic culture where personal initiative and hard work are recognized and rewarded

Job Summary

Address:

Cyberjaya, Selangor, Malaysia

City:

MYS-SELANGOR-CYBERJAYA

Country:

Malaysia

40

Full time

Wealth Management

Contract (Fixed Term)

item.title: Lead Data Scientist, Fraud Data Science and Innovation
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Lead Data Scientist, Fraud Data Science and Innovation

Job Description

What\'s the opportunity?

You will lead Fraud Management(FM) Machine Learning(ML) and Artificial Intelligence(AI) advancements, develop strategy for predictive fraud detection ML models and explore ML/AI technique application. You will set standards for ML model development, ensuring consistency, accuracy and repeatability, collaborate with partners and work with Fraud Strategy, Fraud IT and Enterprise Model Risk Management(EMRM) on emerging fraud risks, solution design and model validation frameworks. You will fully comprehend the technical architecture supporting the Fraud decisioning ecosystem and how it supports DSA detection requirements. As a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on FM initiatives, you will collaborate with stakeholders at varying levels of seniority.

What will you do?

  • Lead the development and implementation of the Data Science Machine Learning (ML) strategy and act as key point of contact for all ML models
  • Develop supervised fraud detection models and explore opportunities for unsupervised/anomaly detection/NLP applications
  • Plan timelines, resource allocation, standards and best practices for ML model development with DS&I and be responsible for technical validation exercises for new model deployments
  • Collaborate effectively with partners in Fraud IT on continuous improvement of the fraud detection ecosystem, understanding the technical requirements and their impact on the business users in DSA
  • Work with EMRM to enable efficient model validation and develop a strong relationship with Fraud Strategy partners focused on identifying emerging fraud risks and how the application of ML can minimize these risks
  • Identify opportunities and develop solutions to automate/enhance processes through analytical tools and workflows; and utilize technology tools to build the most effective solution; Python, R, Spark, PySpark, etc.
  • Provide thought leadership to support Fraud Management’s key priorities where there is a dependence on data analytics, machine learning or data engineering
  • Leverage expertise with ML and programming to provide support to the rest of the DSA team as required

What you need to succeed

Must have:

  • 5+ years of experience in Machine Learning, data mining and statistics
  • Strong practical knowledge of, and proven experience with, analytical software packages and programming languages: Python, R, SQL, etc.
  • Working knowledge of Big Data Framework (Hadoop, etc.)
  • Strong understanding of version control (Git/GitHub)
  • Strong problem solving, research and quantitative skills
  • Exceptional time management and organizational skills, ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize workload effectively
  • Proven ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data
  • Professional oral and written communication and presentation skills, including the ability to effectively communicate analytical recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Knowledge of Canadian banking and payment industry, payments transaction data and financial fraud
  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline

Nice to have:

  • Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline
  • Experience with Docker and Kubernetes
  • Experience with Cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, OpenShift)
  • Prior experience in fraud detection and data analytics

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program
  • Leaders who support your development
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Opportunity to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Job Type:

Regular

item.title: Trainee Administrator/Administrator , Data Management & Quality
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Trainee Administrator/Administrator , Data Management & Quality

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will be working as part of the back office Data Management & Quality team, checking and inputting changes to client information (such as changes in address, contact details or closures) and product information (such as a new bank account). You will learn about our applications and their impact on regulatory reporting and assist with standardisation projects. Knowledge of Know Your Client Documentation and the financial environment is advantageous but not essential.

UKJERSEYWM

What will you do?

  • Ensure the integrity of data across and between multiple systems is maintained

  • Complete data maintenance and supporting administrative tasks throughout the Client and Product lifecycle

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure that all issues, queries and obstacles are satisfactorily resolved to ensure that tasks are completed in a timely and efficient manner

  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of an appropriate control environment in line with applicable data standards, regulatory requirements and business unit procedures

  • Contribute to the ongoing efficiency, innovations, process review and development of Data Management and Quality

  • Act as an SME to assist with Optimisation activities including the development of new RPA processes, Service Requests and core application development

  • Assist in the rotation and remediation of daily control reports and collation of task information for Management Information

  • Assist with the delivery and completion of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Post Implementation Verification (PIV) testing


What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Strong communication, influencing and negotiating skills

  • Collaborative and consultative approach along with team player attitude

  • Ability to make decisions, use initiative and escalate issues

  • Ability to execute tasks within defined service level agreements

  • A proven track record in excellent service delivery

  • Knowledge/experience with Client Due Diligence (CDD) / Know Your Client (KYC) and supporting documentation

  • Ability and willingness to work from home in line with the hybrid working team charter


Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge/experience with Client Due Diligence (CDD) / Know Your Client (KYC) and supporting documentation

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Flexible working options fully supported

Saint Helier, Jersey

item.title: Director Data Strategy and Governance
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director Data Strategy and Governance

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

RBC Capital Markets is undertaking a green field project to build a new capability to serve corporate clients.

Your role will be to use your deep knowledge of data, combined with your understanding of client and business needs to create the business context to bring our data to life for the US Cash Management team and clients alike. You are a thoughtful, proactive, creative, analytical individual with a passion for solving problems for your colleagues and clients through the use of data.

What will you do?

  • Develop and drive implementation of the overall Data Strategy for the Business
  • Collaborate with Technology on the build of the foundational data layer including data infrastructure and provide business requirements and direction
  • Work with Business and IT partners to define strategic and tactical data requirements of the organization to fulfill business needs.
  • Drive the key initiatives of the Data team and make sure the initiatives are aligned and run smoothly
  • Be the Data SME and primary contact supporting the Business’ various projects, with a focus on data governance, quality, requirements and specifications.
  • Understand the data sources, flows, architecture, data repositories, data requirements for downstream users
  • Working with the Data Governance team, review and update Critical Data Element (CDEs), identifying data risks and corresponding data controls.
  • Review, understand and challenge the lineage of documented CDEs
  • Working with partners, to ensure the Business complies with data privacy policies and data protection regulations.
  • Supporting the data requirements for Client Statements
  • Keep up to date with Agile best practices
  • Foster a data-driven culture

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 10+ years experience supporting a data initiative
  • Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Technology or related field
  • Database development, querying and analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Oracle,  Python, Data Visualization, Tableau etc
  • Passion for data, and commitment to learn new data capabilities
  • Knowledge of data governance and data management concepts such as critical data elements, data lineage, data accuracy and completeness and data controls
  • Understanding of technical data concepts such as data ingestion, data warehouse, data lakes, master reference data, data models, systems of record, aggregation layer and reporting systems
  • Experience with using Jira and Confluence
  • Excellent business communication skills (written and oral). 
  • Ability to work independently and possess strong analytical and data problem-solving skills
  • Strong collaboration and relationship management skills
  • Effective time management and organizational skills to meet tight timeframes, as well as flexibility to adapt to changing priorities while assessing impact to existing work

What\'s in It for You?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Positive work culture emphasizing diversity and inclusion, volunteerism and community involvement
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including great benefits, annual incentive program and recognition
  • Leaders who support your development
  • A dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and grow your career

Work-life integration

Job Summary

RBC Capital Markets is undertaking a green field project to build a new capability to serve corporate clients.

Your role will be to use your deep knowledge of data, combined with your understanding of client and business needs to create the business context to bring our data to life for the US Cash Management team and clients alike. You are a thoughtful, proactive, creative, analytical individual with a passion for solving problems for your colleagues and clients through the use of data.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

37.5

Full time

Platform:

Capital Markets

Regular

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. item.title: Senior Manager, BI & Data Analysis
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, BI & Data Analysis

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role, you will become the subject matter expert for Cards, Payments & Loyalty Data, playing a key role in leading the BI Tool Tableau development within the Decision Management team. You will drive superior business results, by providing key strategic insights and recommendations on new and existing business opportunities, through in-depth knowledge of the RBC data warehouse environment and data lake. You will champion the use of deep analytic rigour as the basis for the decision management methodology, and leverage all available sources of data to create value within the business.

What will you do?

BI Tool & Analytic support

  • Transform the way cards, payments, and loyalty use data by developing advanced reporting and analytics to serve external and internal clients.

  • Develop new methodologies and business analytical tools to address complex business issues. Identify, measure, and monitor the impact and success of new and existing initiatives, including but not limited to pricing, acquisition, and portfolio management.

  • Coach/Mentor junior team members in term of building proper and impactful Tableau reports

Data Analysis

  • Become the data subject matter expert (SME) for Cards, Payments and Loyalty, Retail, Small business and Commercial credit card holders.

  • Support the roll-out of key business projects and ensure data and analytics capabilities are developed on time and on budget.

  • Help in data preparation for complex analytical projects

  • Responsible for the rapid identification, prioritization and deployment of reporting and analytics to define new potential business opportunities and to make well informed decisions (short and long term) through the use of internal, industry and competitor data.

  • Provide and/or support reporting requests, on cards, payments, and loyalty clients and for tracking the Moneris Transformational Program to appropriate groups (both internal and external), as required.

Value Added Consultation

  • Be a thought leader within the Reporting COE, applying a strategic lens to the development of reporting insights, advancing technical capabilities and influencing an environment of continuous improvement.

  • Lead or co-ordinate projects with other partner groups to meet business requirements on behalf of Cards, Payments & Loyalty that are completed using other Centre’s of Excellence.

  • Support senior management with the Reporting & Analytics workstream of the Moneris Transformation Program (MTP) as part of the Commerce & Payment mega-journey

  • Support senior management by analyzing new business opportunities and providing recommendations and support in developing business cases.

  • Frequently interact with partners to understand their business processes and objectives in order to define/recommend data & reporting solutions to meet those objectives. Build and manage effective relationships with key stakeholders, functional groups and other relevant members of the enterprise and our T&O partners.

  • Participate in decision making related to ongoing prioritization and reprioritization of work to accommodate evolving business priorities and changing needs.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • 4+ years of experience with Tableau

  • 5+ years of experience with relational databases (Db2, MySQL, Teradata) as well as 2+ years of experience with big data environment / processing tools such as Hadoop (Hive, HDFS, Pig) and Apache Spark

  • Strong coding experience in programming languages like SQL, Python

  • Effective storytelling skills – written and verbal. Produce simple, concise presentations and visualizations to clearly communicate to senior leadership. Data translation: Insights, Business Implications and Business Recommendations.

  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively through impact and influence in a cross-functional environment, as well as independently with initiative taking ownership.

  • A ‘Growth Mindset’ – embraces new data mining tools and different analytical techniques to generate impactful insights. Proactive and inquisitive mindset, continuously seeking opportunities to improve existing reporting, processes and streamline activities

Nice to have:

  • Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent related experience

  • Strong proficiency with statistical software – SAS

  • Problem solver and logical thinker who can trace back and identify root cause of issues and articulate impacts of changes

  • Knowledge of credit cards, payments, banking, RBC databases and/or RBC data warehouse environment

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-06-09

Application Deadline:

2023-06-23

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Data Analyst – Data Governance
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analyst – Data Governance

Job Description

What is the opportunity?


To support the execution of specific data standards, initiatives and drive forward the culture of good data practice and data governance within RBC BlueBay Data management office, DMO.  

The DMO is responsible for embedding a data management culture into the organization by proactively challenging the way the firm works with data


What will you do?

  • Establish clear data ownership and accountability across the firm.
  • Support the execution of specific data standards and initiatives, writing and reviewing policy documentation. 
  • Collaborative mind-set with the ability to bring teams to work together towards a common goal, listen to different views and facilitate decision making in a proactive manner 
  • Ability to work with data owners, evaluating situations quickly with the ability to accurately diagnose the source issue of data quality incidents
  • Establish key performance indicators with respective data owners, to accurately monitor data quality; specifically, completeness, accuracy, timeliness and consistency.
  • Attend incident meeting to understand data related issues and devise data quality metrics to measure progress and overall data improvements.
  • Methodical, concise and accurate, with strong attention to detail and excellent organisational skills, including the ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines Problem solver thinking of new ideas and challenge existing workflows, to improve data quality and levels of data assurance


What do you need to succeed?
 

Must-have

  • Data literacy, skilled in Excel, 
  • Experience of working at a financial institution 
  • Strong communication skills 


Nice-to-have

  • Basic understanding on constructing SQL 
  • Familiar with Python
  • Familiar with Tableau


What is in it for you?


We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
